item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Online retailers EA has cleared for BF3:

Origin
GameStop
Impulse
Direct2Drive
Amazon
Best Buy
Gamersgate

No Steam yet, but lots of their lesser competition.

@Kairouseki, gametrailers

Read full topic
item.source: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover

item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I should fit into the recommended specs. Only thing I’m not sure about is the video card. I have a Radeon HD 5870.

Edit: Also, just curious where did you find those?

Read full topic
item.source: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover

item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Nerdguy
item.description:
Medevilae:

-bump-

Spec requirements are here.

Minimum

Hard Drive Space: 15 GB for disc version or 10 GB for digital version
OS: Windows Vista or Windows 7
Processor: Core 2 Duo @ 2.0GHzRAM2GB
Video Card: DirectX 10 or 11 compatible Nvidia or AMD ATI card

Recommended

Hard Drive Space: 15 GB for disc version or 10 GB for digital version
OS: Windows 7 64-bit
Processor: Quad-core Intel or AMD CPURAM 4GB
Video Card: DirectX 11 Nvidia or AMD ATI card, GeForce GTX 460, Radeon Radeon HD 6850

Oh shit, I can still play at low/medium i guess

Read full topic

item.description:
Someonerandm:

If Crysis 2 being pulled is unrelated to Origin, as it seems, then things look fine for BF3 being on steam.

Alice just came to Steam, so I’m pretty positive we’ll see BF3 now.

Everything else is effing a.

item.source: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover

item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Source?

EDIT:EDIT: Well fuck it, but basically BioWare is EA published but have stated they will still be putting out games on Steam, so I don’t see why DICE wouldn’t at all, despite the trends.

What people don’t realize is Crysis 2 was pulled for unrelated reasons, while Alice and Star Wars on the other hand just had greedy devs who thought going exclusive with Origin’s mouth watering contract would make them more money.

Read full topic
item.source: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover

item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Source?

Also any box versions will require either Steam or Origin, probably origin. Just so you know.

Read full topic
item.source: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover

item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Maxey:

https://www.vg247.com/2011/06/15/crysis-2-now-only-on-origin-d2d-impulse-more/

Oh shit. Now there’s a strong possibility that BF3 might not end up on Steam.

I won’t buy it through Origin that’s for sure.

TFA says “Crytek has an agreement with another download service which violates the new rules from Steam and resulted in its expulsion of Crysis 2 from Steam.”

Also BF3 is still going to be on Steam.

Read full topic
item.source: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover

item.title: Battlefield 3 finnaly show up - on Game Informer's March cover
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Well I already preordered it retail because I didn’t want to wait for it to get on Steam. Hopefully it doesn’t need to be redeemed on Origin.
